Class FullTimeEmployee

java.lang.Object
com.mycompany.payrollsystem.staff.Staff
com.mycompany.payrollsystem.staff.FullTimeEmployee
public class FullTimeEmployee extends Staff

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class com.mycompany.payrollsystem.staff.Staff

    id, name, scalePoint, title

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FullTimeEmployee(String name, int id, String category, String title, int scalePoint, String password)
    Constructor for full time employees Takes the below parameters and creates a fullTimeEmployee object This is done by calling the default constructor specified in the staff class with name, id, title, scalePoint and password, then with category and salary after as they are not in the super constructor

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    checkTopScale()
    A method with no added parameters This method checks whether an employee's scale point has reached the maximum for their job title If the employee reaches their top scale point, the date and time at which this occurred is logged This time since the employee has been at the max scalePoint is stored in topScaleStartTime It then resets the topScaleStartTime to 0 when an employee is no longer at the top of their scalePoint scale
    String
    getCategory()
    A simple getter method for getting an enployees category
    double
    getSalary()
    Calls the method getPay from the ScaleLoader class Calls this method passing category, title, and the string value of the integer scalePoint
    long
    getYearsAtTop()
    This method is used to determine how long (in full years) an employee has been at their maximum scale point.
    void
    promoteToNewTitle(String newTitle)
    A method used for promoting an employee to a new title Takes the new title the employee will be promoted to as the only parameter Employees default datafield "title" is updated to the new one which is passed in Determines how many years the employee has been at the top scale point for their previous title.
    String
    toString()
    toString method for displaying a full time employees details
    boolean
    updateScalePoint()
    A method with no parameters This method advances an employees current scalePoint by one- provided their current scalePoint is not the maximum scale point within their title Also automatically adjusts the employee's salary after each scale point update.

    addPayslip, authenticate, getId, getName, getPassword, getScalePoint, getTitle, viewPayslips

  • Constructor Details

    • FullTimeEmployee

      public FullTimeEmployee(String name, int id, String category, String title, int scalePoint, String password)
      Constructor for full time employees Takes the below parameters and creates a fullTimeEmployee object This is done by calling the default constructor specified in the staff class with name, id, title, scalePoint and password, then with category and salary after as they are not in the super constructor
      Parameters:
      name - employees name
      id - employees id
      category - employees current category
      title - employees current title
      scalePoint - employees current scalePoint
      password - employees current password

  • Method Details

    • checkTopScale

      public void checkTopScale()
      A method with no added parameters This method checks whether an employee's scale point has reached the maximum for their job title If the employee reaches their top scale point, the date and time at which this occurred is logged This time since the employee has been at the max scalePoint is stored in topScaleStartTime It then resets the topScaleStartTime to 0 when an employee is no longer at the top of their scalePoint scale

    • updateScalePoint

      public boolean updateScalePoint()
      A method with no parameters This method advances an employees current scalePoint by one- provided their current scalePoint is not the maximum scale point within their title Also automatically adjusts the employee's salary after each scale point update.
      Specified by:
      updateScalePoint in class Staff
      Returns:
      false if at the top of the scalePoint, true if not

    • getYearsAtTop

      public long getYearsAtTop()
      This method is used to determine how long (in full years) an employee has been at their maximum scale point.
      Returns:
      how many full years the employee has been at the top of their payscale

    • promoteToNewTitle

      public void promoteToNewTitle(String newTitle)
      A method used for promoting an employee to a new title Takes the new title the employee will be promoted to as the only parameter Employees default datafield "title" is updated to the new one which is passed in Determines how many years the employee has been at the top scale point for their previous title. Assigns new scalePoint within new title based off that Employees salary is recalculated to reflect their new position
      Parameters:
      newTitle - The employees new title which they are being promoted to

    • getSalary

      public double getSalary()
      Calls the method getPay from the ScaleLoader class Calls this method passing category, title, and the string value of the integer scalePoint
      Returns:
      the employee's current salary based on their category, title, and scalePoint

    • getCategory

      public String getCategory()
      A simple getter method for getting an enployees category
      Returns:
      Employees current category

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString method for displaying a full time employees details
      Overrides:
      toString in class Staff
      Returns:
      displays a fullTime Employees current name, id, category, title, scalePoint, and salary
